content:
EXISTING STRUCTURES
─────────────────────
### Extraction System at Position (-3.5, 27.5)
Consists of:
– A burner inserter located at (-3.5, 27.5) with a drop position of (-3.5, 28.5)
– A wooden chest at (-3.5, 26.5) acting as a potential buffer

### Copper Cable Factory near Position (2.5, 17.5)
Consists of:
– An input chest at (2.5, 17.5)
– A factory burner inserter retrieved at (2.5, 16.5)
– A dedicated burner inserter placed at (3.5, 17.5) using direction RIGHT (neighboring the input chest)
– An assembling machine at (1.5, 19.5)
– A lab (electrical_id=7106) associated with the production network

### Depot Belt Network at Position (3.5, 15.5)
Consists of:
– A wooden chest placed at (3.5, 15.5) serving as the belt depot
– An adjacent transport belt segment at (4.5, 15.5)
– A dedicated depot burner inserter placed at (3.5, 14.5) using direction UP (with its pickup position serving as the final belt target)

### Electricity Generator at Position (-0.5, 24.5)
Consists of:
– A steam engine (generator) at (-0.5, 24.5)
– A boiler positioned at (-5.5, 24.0)
– An offshore pump at (-7.5, 25.5)
(All connected via appropriate pipe and power networks)

### Ore Processing Facility around Positions (-3.0 to -5.5, 19.0 to 21.5)
Consists of:
– A stone furnace at (-3.0, 19.0) producing iron-plates
– A stone furnace at (-4.0, 21.0) producing copper-plates
– A wooden chest at (-4.5, 18.5)
– A wooden chest at (-5.5, 21.5)

ERROR TIPS
──────────
• Belt Connection Failures
  – When connecting transport belts, errors indicate that the target is a Prototype.SteamEngine. Ensure that an inserter is added to feed items into the steam engine and use that inserter as the connection target.

• Entity Placement Distance Errors
  – If placement fails because the target position is too far from the player (e.g. distance 15.89 vs. maximum allowed 10), move the player closer to the target position before attempting placement.

• Undefined Variable Errors
  – Errors such as “NameError: name ‘target_chest’ is not defined” point to incorrect or inconsistent variable naming. Double-check that variable names are defined and used consistently.

• Missing Inventory Items
  – When errors report that an entity (such as a wooden chest) is missing from the inventory, verify and ensure the required item is present before attempting to place it.
